description: News, updates and information for the Bailiwick of Guernsey.
title: Guernsey news and updates: 9-13 November
title_page: Guernsey news and updates: 9-13 November - BBC News
maintext:
More than 1,000 people have used the States of Guernsey online travel tracker when entering the bailiwick since its launch in October, chief executive Paul Whitfield said.
The website enables people to submit their personal and travel details before departure to assist the performance of testing and the track and trace system.
He said: "Unsurprisingly there has been some minor issues since launch that have resulted in longer than anticipated queues on occasions."
Mr Whitfield emphasised that while the States was trying to make the process a "reasonable experience", he said people should acknowledge the "significantly different requirements" a border testing regime creates.
He asked all people travelling or the families of those arriving to "bear with" staff managing the ports of entry.
